reviews.review: Steam Workshop support! I would have been playing so much more of this If I had known there were mods for it. My main problem with this game was how similar all the characters were to each other, and how dull and un-sexy the character designs were. The weapons were all pretty dull too. The DLC helps with this, and the mods REALLY help. We got waifu mods for days now!‚ù§Ô∏èüíñüíóüíï

TLDR; Get KIlling Floor 2. It's KF1, but better. 

When I was a preteen, Killing Floor was amazing. It's the very reason I made a steam account. The game was the pinacle of Co-op class-based Zombie shooter. Now... now it hasn't aged well. After playing KF2 for some time, I just cannot get back to KF1. The engine it runs on is dated and it's far from visually appealing. Balance is lackluster.
This game lost its shine. I loved this game, but I can no longer recomend it. Get KF2. It's only $10 more (and doesn't have $24 of new weapon dlc). The ONLY thing I miss about this game now is the maps. This game has fantastic maps, and especially an abundance of map mods.

Even if this is on sale, I don't suggest you get it if you can get KF2 instead.
KF2 has:
More enemy types (including 4 bosses instead of 1!)
More classes (Perks)
More weapons
More active players/servers
Better balance
No game changing dlc (Weapon Packs--but it does have 2 weapons that require you or a teamate to own a certain game)
Weapon upgrades
Prestiage
More weapon cosmetics (through lootboxes)
Perk system for a bit of flexability of builds
Better graphics
New content in development
Fairer leveling system
...the list goes on.

I can not advise KF2 enough. It's so much better than KF1 now, and makes the original unplayable.

If you haven't at least given this game a try, you're doing it wrong. A classic no doubt, and In my honest opinion... better than the sequel!

This one still has servers running objective game modes, KF2 doesn't even have that yet.

Wide selection of weapons to suit any playstyle, and the co-op gameplay rivals that of Call of Duty's "Nazi Zombies" perhaps even besting it by maybe a pubic hair.

Killing Floor es un juego first person shooter con oleadas de zombies que trataran de joderte sea como sea y tu trataras de evitarlo.

Eliges tu clase, a medida que avanzas puedes equiparte mejor con armas mas poderosas para destruir un par de cabezas y hacer maratones de todo el mapa si te persigue un Fleshpound, sin olvidar el boss (Que es te va a dar una buena si no sabes manejarlo).

Positivos:

- Rendimiento y optimizaci√≥n buena
- Variedad de logros y horas de juego
- Comunidad activa, agradable y que apoya el juego aun en estos tiempos
- Gr√°ficas buenas teniendo en cuenta el tiempo que lleva y la fecha en que salio
- Voces, di√°logos y subtitulos bien logrados en el caso de Espa√±ol Espa√±a (Adem√°s de graciosos)
- Servidores y partidas faciles de encontrar con muy buena conexi√≥n y ping (En mi caso, Colombia)
- Variedad de clases, personajes, mapas y como no pueden faltar los buenos mods y Steam Workshop

Negativos:

- Dosh para personajes y armas (Cantidad de DLC's absurda)
- No se guarda la preferencia de tu personaje y cada partida te lo cambia por el default (No es muy relevante pero es molesto)
- No mas actualizaciones o apoyo por parte de los desarolladores (Aunque esto se entiende por su consiguiente KF2)

Buen juego pero no vale la pena comprarlo a su precio original, ademas esta obsoleto y ortodoxo teniendo en cuenta que le sigue el KF2. Si deseas probarlo estar√° bien para jugar con amigos o retarte a desbloquear todos sus logros pero mi consejo es que vayas por el 2 sin pensarlo.

Mi calificaci√≥n: 8.5

Did everything I've ever wanted in a "zombie wave" game. It's basically CoD's Nazi Zombies and CS's shop system bundled together to form a beautiful masterpiece. It's one of those games that're better played with friends.
excelene juego, aunque para los tiempos de hoy (a√±o 2018) tiene graficas un poco menores, no quita el entretenimiento y las horas de diversi√≥n.

Apesar de eu n√£o ser um grande f√£ de FPSs sem compatibilidade com controle, devo reconhecer que esse √© um jogo incrivelmente divertido. Me agradou mais que Left 4 dead 1 e 2, pois aqui o jogador n√£o depende de ser salvo por ningu√©m, pois os zumbis de elite n√£o "grudam" em vc, como acontece toda hora em left 4 dead. Em outras palavras, aqui vc pode bancar o lobo solit√°rio e se separar do grupo. Isso sem mencionar que o game √© plenamente democr√°tico e agrada jogadores de todos os estilos, dos mais casuais at√© os mais hardcore devido a boa variedade de n√≠veis de dificuldade e quantidade de inimigos na fase, variando de acordo com o n√∫mero de jogadores na miss√£o e de acordo com a dificuldade selecionada. 

Outro aspecto relevante √© que n√£o faltam jogadores e servidores em qualquer dificuldade. Inclusive, as configura√ß√µes de condi√ß√µes de jogo permitem uma boa gama de op√ß√µes, o que aumenta ainda mais o n√∫mero de jogadores.

E pra finalizar, o jogo tem editor de cen√°rios e acesso ao workshop, que nesse caso possui mods incr√≠veis. Tem mais mods de Doom no workshop para Killing Floor do que para Left 4 Dead 2 !
